subject: Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.
commitMessage:
Modification about smack label of db file belong to process.

[Problem] 
Most db files have 'floor' label.  Because these are created during image creation time.
Therefore no process can write the dbs (since 'floor' label allows only read and execute)

[Solution] 
Modify smack label of the db files based on condition below referring three domain model
Condition1. Assign domain of process which creates db files
Condition2. Assign domain of process accesses db files.

Change-Id: Ib3e0f1f36865658de4404eb007bf85f6269800ff
Signed-off-by: jooseong.lee <jooseong.lee@samsung.com>

subject: TIVI-2074: Remove smack labels from socket activation file
commitMessage:
TIVI-2074: Remove smack labels from socket activation file

We have to remove use of the Tizen 2.2 smack labels until the
the Tizen 3.0 security domains are in place.  Otherwise nothing
can communicate with anthing else.

Change-Id: I3ec2c0079ffe2178034118c807faaadf28e81b38
Signed-off-by: Rusty Lynch <rusty.lynch@intel.com>

subject: Tizen policy change for untrusted widgets
commitMessage:
Tizen policy change for untrusted widgets

It is decided that untrusted widget( It means an widget application of which a root certificate of signed certificate is not registered in Tizen Platform) should be blocked to use public privilege APIs.
For preventing using API, TizenPolicy.xml file should be modified.

Change-Id: Id70a300762c6843b282f39329782491055a20419
Signed-off-by: Ashish Mehta <ashish.mehta@samsung.com>

comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 1:

How does one manage to install an application without it being trusted?  How do i test this condition?
Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 2:

With this change all of my previously working wgt files are uninstallable anymore.  I don't know if this is because we have some failure in the web runtime or there is some special step required in creating a wgt that is deemed 'trusted' that I am not taking.

My request is to hold off on accepting this change till all the other required moving parts are in and working in the system.  I would rather have the ability to run untrusted web apps now, while we are ages away from a release, to unblock testing and exposing other system breakage, then to turn on some strict notion of trust that stops everyone from using the system and seeing what else is broken.
Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 3:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 3:

[BUILD CHECK RESULT] This change is built against OBS project Tizen:IVI:Release: 

 repository     arch           result         

 standard       i586           succeeded

Patch Set 3:

Please sign wgts using SDK to make them trusted apps.

Patch Set 3:

Dear Reviewers,

The change is related to removal of provision of using any privileges by untrusted applications. I agree to the concerns raised related to already installed widgets.

As rightly pointed out by Mr JaeWon Lee, its advised that proper key certs are generated using SDK, which will be the minimal overhead wrt current scenario.

But this will provide additional security by disallowing any privilege usage by untrusted apps.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 3:

Dear Rusty,

Please, let us know when you ready.
Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 3: Verified+1
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: Fix .service and install it into dbus system service directory
commitMessage:
Fix .service and install it into dbus system service directory

In Tizen 3.0, dbus will running with an unprivileged user 'dbus' and use
an setuid servicehelper to activate system service, which should be
installed into the system-service directory if it provides system wide
service, and "User=" field is must to have to servicehelper.

Bug: https://bugs.tizen.org/jira/browse/PTREL-124
Change-Id: Iaa0c1107a79f5a253c7e75866b19a8b2d32c4bd8
Signed-off-by: Chengwei Yang <chengwei.yang@intel.com>

subject: Reset manifest to default floor domain
commitMessage:
Reset manifest to default floor domain

Change-Id: Ia4dead4dfd5ea698e664a6b69976b80f3f7ea334
Signed-off-by: Michael Demeter <michael.demeter@intel.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 2.
Uploaded patch set 3.
Uploaded patch set 4.
Uploaded patch set 5.

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)
Uploaded patch set 6.
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1
Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 6: Verified-1 -Code-Review

Web apps fail to launch with this change.

When running 'wrt-launcher -s APPID', a web page opens with the title "Web page temporarily not available".

I also see an error logged in the systemd journal:

wrt_launchpad_daemon[178]: CRI<251>: /home/abuild/rpmbuild/BUILD/webkit2-efl-123997_0.11.47/Source/WebKit2/WebProcess/InjectedBundle/efl/InjectedBundleEfl.cpp:45 load() Error loading the injected bundle from /usr/lib/libwrt-injected-bundle.so: Wrong file format or no file module found

Patch Set 6:

seriously? you get all of this just because the manifest was reset?

Patch Set 6:

No, I think this a regression from merging the 2.2 branch.

The systemd service may need to be updated, I will retest today.

Patch Set 6: -Verified Code-Review+1

The wrt-security-daemon.socket file change (removing SmackLabelIP{In,Out}) doesn't appear to have an effect...

Regardless, this change looks okay to me, but I can't verify that it fixes anything.
Patch Set 6: Verified+1 Code-Review+2
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.
